TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed CspProviderFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies flags that modify the behavior of the cryptographic service providers (CSP).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags CreateEphemeralKey = int32(128)

Docs.summary: Create a temporary key that is released when the associated Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) object is closed. Do not use this flag if you want your key to be independent of the RSA object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > The CreateEphemeralKey flag provides temporary keys with more reliable cleanup. If this flag is not used, the common language runtime (CLR) generates a randomly named key when an RSA object is created. When the object is finalized or disposed of, the key is deleted. When impersonation is in effect, not explicitly calling `Dispose` can potentially create a problem. For example, if you use impersonation, create an RSA object, and do not dispose of it, the finalizer thread (which is not impersonating) can fail to delete the key, and then throws an exception. This exception is unhandled and can terminate the process. The resources allocated to the key are not recovered, resulting in a memory leak. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermission> demand is suppressed by this flag.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags NoFlags = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags NoPrompt = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Prevent the CSP from displaying any user interface (UI) for this context.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseArchivableKey = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Allow a key to be exported for archival or recovery.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseDefaultKeyContainer = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use key information from the default key container.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseExistingKey = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Use key information from the current key.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseMachineKeyStore = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Use key information from the computer's key store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseNonExportableKey = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Use key information that cannot be exported.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags UseUserProtectedKey = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Notify the user through a dialog box or another method when certain actions are attempting to use a key. This flag is not compatible with the NoPrompt flag.
